topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Creating and Deleting Ports

body.p: A port is a connection point for attaching a single device, such as the NIC of a virtual server, to a virtual network. You can configure rich network topologies by creating and configuring networks and subnets, and then instructing other OpenStack services like Compute to attach virtual devices to ports on these networks.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the Network panel.
Click the name of the network you want to work with.
On the Network Detail page, click Create Port.

On the Create Port screen:
Enter a descriptive name for the port.
Leave the Admin State field selected to create a port in the active state. Or, clear the field to create a non-active port.
Optionally, specify a device ID to assign the port to that device.
Optionally, specify a device name to assign the port to that device.
If you do not know the device ID and name, you can create the port and later edit the port to add the ID and name.

Click Create Port.
A message appears indicating if the port was successfully created. When the port is created, an available fixed IP address out of one the designated subnets is associated with the port.
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the Network panel.
Click the name of the network you want to work with.
On the Network Detail page, for the port you want to delete, click Edit Port.

On the Edit Port screen:
Leave the Admin State field selected to create a port in the active state. Or, clear the field to create a non-active port.
Specify a device ID to assign the port to that device.
Specify a device name to assign the port to that device.

Click Save Changes.
A message appears indicating if the port was successfully modified.
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the Network panel.
Click the name of the network you want to work with.
On the Network Detail page, for the port you want to delete, click Edit Port then Delete Port

In the confirmation screen, click Delete Port.
A message appears indicating if the port was deleted successfully.
